answers.answer: The major hospitals in NYC do the hydrogen breath test for lactose intolerance only. New York Presbyterian does it for lactose intolerance and for IBS. Check the website nyp.orgNaomi Berri Diabetes Center of Columbia University (across from New York Presbyterian Hospital uptown) maybe able to help you. They are a very large community diabetes center and may help you in the right direction.

question: My nutritionist has recommended to my gastrointerologist that I have a hydrogen breath test for Fructose intolerance/malabsorbtion. My doctor does not know which hospitals in New York City offer this test. I would like to know this information. In addition, I would like to know about any support groups, or online resources with information regarding Dietary Fructose Intolerance. It is difficult to choose a menu/diet as there is not a large body of information on the topic. Thank you.
title: Fructose Intolerance in NYC
